intro: Hieracium gabrusense, commonly known as the Gabroso golden hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces yellow or orange flowers that are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, with narrow, hairy leaves. Hieracium gabrusense is often found in dry, well-drained areas and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
